New Records: Fakhar Zaman scored the fastest-ever World Cup century
Key Match Events: Fakhar Zaman's unbeaten 126* from just 81 balls helped Pakistan beat New Zealand by 21 runs via DLS and keep their chances of qualification alive
Rachin Ravindra scored his third century of the tournament and Rachin Ravindra scored his third century of the tournament
Fakhar Zaman hit thirteen sixes in this World Cup
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan need 402 runs to stay in the World Cup
England will be OFFICIALLY OUT if New Zealand beat Pakistan in the early game
Post-Match Reflections: Fakhar Zaman is the player of the match
Babar Azam said that when they started batting, they believed and planned to build a partnership, and Fakhar Zaman's innings was incredible
Kane Williamson said that Pakistan played exceptionally well, gave themselves every chance and got over the line, they were certainly on target with their chase
Miscellaneous Highlights: The rain stopped play in Bangalore, but Pakistan were ahead on DLS
Pakistan are 21 RUNS AHEAD against New Zealand on DLS after further rain in Bangalore
England can still qualify for the semi-finals if they beat Australia
